title: Our transport system is in crisis, but electric 'air taxis' are not the answer
text:
There ought to be a collective noun for tech entrepreneurs, or “founders” in the jargon. A speculation of founders? An enthusiasm of founders? Or, as with another slightly mad, bustling herd (of guinea fowl) a confusion of founders?

Whatever the answer, there is something delightfully, deliriously invigorating about watching a crowd of hugely well-resourced, fantastically talented engineers and entrepreneurs hare about, all pursuing the same world-changing breakthrough they’re absolutely 100pc sure is at their fingertips, yet all with utterly different ideas of how to seize it.

So it is with flying cars. Because let’s face it, the Electric Vertical Take off and Landing (eVTOL) market is essentially...
description: There ought to be a collective noun for tech entrepreneurs, or “founders” in the jargon.
